abstract: Federal officials are weighing approval of a natural gas pipeline that would terminate in the West Village of Manhattan; $850 million project, developed by Spectra Energy of Houston, calls for 15 miles of new pipeline to run from Staten Island to Bayonne and Jersey City before crossing into Manhattan; city officials support project but opposition campaign is gaining some heft.
snippet: New York City says a 15-mile natural gas line is needed to augment energy supplies, but there are concerns about safety.
lead_paragraph: New York City says a 15-mile natural gas line is needed to augment energy supplies, but there are concerns about safety.

headline.main: Pipeline Plan Stirs Debate on Both Sides of Hudson
headline.print_headline: Plan for Interstate Gas Pipeline Provokes Debate on Both Sides of the Hudson
headline.seo: Gas Pipeline to Manhattan Stirs Debate in 2 States
